summary.para: The GetState method retrieves the current configuration settings for the VCM codec currently being used.

param.name: pcbState
param.para: Pointer to the size of the state.

returns.para: Return value varies depending on the implementation within each driver.

summary.para: The SendDriverMessage method sends a driver-specific message.

param.name: uMsg
param.para: Message to send to the driver.

returns.para: Return value varies depending on the implementation within each driver.

remarks.para: You should never need to use this method. This method can send any private message to the video compressor (codec). Behavior might be undetermined in response to arbitrary messages; use this method at your own risk.
This method calls the Video for Windows video compression manager (VCM) function to send the message.

summary.para: The SetState method sets configuration for the VCM codec.

returns.para: Return value varies depending on the implementation within each driver.

remarks.para: This method calls the macro, which notifies a video compression driver to set the state of the compressor.

summary.para: The ShowDialog method displays the specified dialog box.

param.name: iDialog
param.para: Dialog box to display. This is a member of the enumeration.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Handle of the dialog box's parent window.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

remarks.para: This method returns an error when asked to display a dialog box while the driver is streaming or displaying another dialog box. While the driver displays the dialog box you can't stream (pause or run) the filter.
IAMVfwCompressDialogs.ShowDialog calls the Video for Windows video compression manager (VCM) functions , , , and to display the appropriate dialog box or determine if one exists.

The VfwCompressDialog_QueryConfig and VfwCompressDialog_QueryAbout members of the enumeration tell you whether or not the configure dialog or about dialog is available. If passed one of these flags, the filter will return S_OK if the dialog exists, and S_FALSE if it does not. If a dialog is available, you call ShowDialog with the value VfwCompressDialog_Config or VfwCompressDialog_About to bring up the dialog.

summary.para: The IAMVfwCompressDialogs interface displays a dialog box provided by a Video for Windows (VFW) codec. The AVI Compressor filter implements this interface. Applications can use it to display one of the dialog boxes (Configure or About) provided by VFW codecs, and to set and retrieve compressor status.
